content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: $EXVAMTU_EXISTS
      operator: equal_to
      value: true
    - name: EC
      operator: exists
Operations:
  - domain: EX
    id: $EXVAMTU_EXISTS
    name: EXVAMTU
    operator: variable_exists
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0107
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When EC exists, EXVAMTU should not be used.
Outcome:
  Message: EXVAMTU is present when EC domain exists.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0107
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: "\"When the EC domain is implemented in conjunction\
                  \ with the EX domain, EXVAMT and EXVAMTU should not be used in EX;\n\
                  \ collected values instead would be represented in ECDOSE and ECDOSU.\""
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 6c
                Section: 6.1.3.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - INTERVENTIONS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - EX

json.Description: When EC exists, EXVAMTU should not be used.

Outcome.Message: EXVAMTU is present when EC domain exists.

Citations.Cited_Guidance:
"When the EC domain is implemented in conjunction with the EX domain, EXVAMT and EXVAMTU should not be used in EX;
 collected values instead would be represented in ECDOSE and ECDOSU."
